snippet: At the crux of the emigration debate is a question: Does one owe a special debt to one's country of birth?
abstract: Masha Gessen Op-Ed article examines effect on home country when citizens, especially best and brightest ones, emigrate elsewhere to escape trouble; describes her own decision to leave Russia and questions it has raised, including whether one owes special debt to one's country of birth, or is under greater obligation to adoptive country than those born there.
lead_paragraph: At the crux of the emigration debate is a question: Does one owe a special debt to one's country of birth?
